name: European Evangelical Alliance
membership: The EEA, a region of the World Evangelical Alliance, is a member of the European Platform on Religious Intolerance and Discrimination (EPRID).
memberOrga:
All member and affiliates of the European Evangelical Alliance are listed in our website:
http://www.europeanea.org/index.php/members/
goal: The EEA, originally created in 1846, is a pan-European movement representing more than 50 national and international evangelical Protestant organisations in 36 nations, and 23 million citizens in the EU. The Brussels office of the EEA promotes active citizenship of its constituency and represents it to the European Institutions.
interests: Borders and Security, Climate Action, Culture, Culture and media, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Youth
euInitiatives:
The European Evangelical Alliance follows closely EU initiatives on Human Dignity, Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms such as Freedom of Speech and Freedom of Religion or Belief in Europe and around the world.
Other areas of interest include EU initiatives to tackle the Migration crisis as well as its efforts to fight poverty and social exclusion.
